meta.job_title: Director of Clinical Outcomes and Services

duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute strategies to enhance clinical outcomes and support for healthcare customers.
Lead and coordinate the Clinical department's focus on project delivery, workflows, outcomes, and customer support.
Analyze data and metrics to evaluate company efficiency and drive an outcomes-driven and values-based approach.
Serve as a clinical subject matter expert and thought leader both internally and externally.
Provide leadership, professional services, training, and clinical support throughout presales and sales engagements, project lifecycle, and post-project phase.
Maintain strong relationships with customers and third parties, ensuring smooth delivery and support of products and services.
Participate in key account sales presentations, demonstrations, clinical evaluations, and clinical training.
Advocate an outcomes-first based approach, KPI measurements, and continuous advancement of product knowledge.
Develop and implement guidelines for employee recruitment, onboarding, training, evaluations, and promotion.
Establish and maintain a trusting, inclusive, and productive environment with opportunities for coaching, mentoring, and development.
Monitor and continuously reshape departmental best practices and processes to provide high employee and customer satisfaction.
Engage in ongoing evaluations of strategic partners within the industry and contribute to ISO certification and FDA certification.
Serve as an escalation point for project implementation, support, and customer-related issues.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing, Registered Nurse BSN degree, or Master’s degree required.
